org.jointheleague.erik.irobot

Class IRobotAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jointheleague.erik.irobot.IRobotAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRobotInterface

    public class IRobotAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRobotInterface
    A concrete class that provides a default implementation of the IRobotInterface. It is a convenience class intended to be extended in order to define customized implementations of the IRobotInterface.

    • Field Summary

      • IRobotAdapter

    • Method Detail

      • drive

        public void drive(int velocity,
                  int radius)
           throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Controls the iRobot's drive wheels. Larger values for the radius makes the iRobot drive straighter, while the smaller values make the iRobot turn more. The radius is measured from the center of the turning circle to the center of iRobot. A positive velocity and a positive radius make the iRobot drive forward while turning toward the left. A negative radius makes the iRobot turn toward the right. Special cases for the radius make iRobot turn in place or drive straight, as specified below. A negative velocity makes iRobot drive backward. Available in modes: Safe or Full

        NOTE: Internal and environmental restrictions may prevent the iRobot from accurately carrying out some drive commands. For example, it may not be possible for the iRobot to drive at full speed in an arc with a large radius of curvature.

        Special cases of radius:

        • Straight 32768 or 32767 = hex 8000 or 7FFF
        • Turn in place clockwise = hex FFFF
        • Turn in place counter-clockwise = hex 0001
        Specified by:
        drive in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        velocity - the average velocity of the wheels in mm/s. Range is -500 to 500
        radius - the turn radius in mm. Range is -2000 to 2000
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • driveDirect

        public void driveDirect(int leftVelocity,
                        int rightVelocity)
                 throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This method lets you control the forward and backward motion of the iRobot by specifying the velocity of each wheel independently. A positive velocity makes that wheel drive forward, while a negative velocity makes it drive backward. Available in modes: Safe or Full
        Specified by:
        driveDirect in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        leftVelocity - Left wheel velocity in mm/s. Range is -500 to 500
        rightVelocity - Right wheel velocity in mm/s. Range is -500 to 500
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • full

        public void full()
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This method gives you complete control over the iRobot by putting the OI into Full mode, and turning off the cliff, wheel-drop and internal charger safety features. That is, in Full mode, the iRobot executes any command that you send it, even if the internal charger is plugged in, or the robot senses a cliff or wheel drop. Available in modes: Passive, Safe, or Full

        Note: Before invoking this method a connection to the iRobot must have been established.

        Specified by:
        full in interface IRobotInterface
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • getAngle

        public int getAngle()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the angle in degrees that the iRobot has turned from the time before last that the angle sensor was read to the last time the angle sensor was read. Counter-clockwise angles are positive and clockwise angles are negative. If the value is not polled frequently enough, it is capped at its minimum or maximum, which are -32768 and 32767 respectively.

        NOTE: The iRobot uses wheel encoders to measure distance and angle. If the wheels slip, the actual distance or angle traveled may differ from the iRobot's measurements.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getAngle in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The angle in degrees that the iRobot has turned.
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getBatteryCapacity

        public int getBatteryCapacity()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the estimated charge capacity of the iRobot's battery in milliamphours (mAh). Note that this value is inaccurate if you are using the alkaline battery pack.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getBatteryCapacity in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The estimated charge capacity of the iRobot's battery in milliamphours (mAh).
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getBatteryCharge

        public int getBatteryCharge()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        The current charge of iRobot's battery in milliamp-hours (mAh). The charge value decreases as the battery is depleted during running and increases when the battery is charged.
        Note that this value will not be accurate if you are using the alkaline battery pack.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getBatteryCharge in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The battery capacity in mAh.
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getChargingState

        public int getChargingState()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This code indicates the iRobot's current charging state. The state is encoded as follows:
        • 0 -- Not charging
        • 1 -- Reconditioning charging
        • 2 -- Full charging
        • 3 -- Trickle chraging
        • 4 -- Waiting
        • 5 -- Fault condition

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getChargingState in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The iRobot's charging state.
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getCurrent

        public int getCurrent()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the current, in milliAmps, flowing into or out of the iRobot's battery. Negative currents indicate that the current is flowing out of the battery, as during normal running. Positive currents indicate that the current is flowing into the battery, as during charging.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getCurrent in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The current in mA
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the distance in mm that the iRobot has travelled from the time before last that the distance sensor was read to the last time the distance sensor was read. This is the same as the sum of the distance traveled by both wheels divided by two. Positive values indicate travel in the forward direction; negative values indicate travel in the reverse direction. If the value is not polled frequently enough, it is capped at its minimum or maximum, which are -32768 amd 32767 respectively.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getDistance in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        the travelled distance in mm
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getInfraredByte

        public int getInfraredByte()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the value of the IR byte received by the iRobot. The value is encoded as follows:

        Remote control values:

        • 129 Left
        • 130 Forward
        • 131 Right
        • 132 Spot
        • 133 Max
        • 134 Small
        • 135 Medium
        • 136 Large / Clean
        • 137 PAUSE
        • 138 Power
        • 139 arc-forward-left
        • 140 arc-forward-right
        • 141 drive-stop
        Remote scheduling values:
        • 142 Send All
        • 143 Seek Dock
        Home base values
        • 240 Reserved
        • 248 Red Buoy
        • 244 Green Buoy
        • 242 Force Field
        • 252 Red Buoy and Green Buoy
        • 250 Red Buoy and Force Field
        • 246 Green Buoy and Force Field
        • 254 Red Buoy, Green Buoy and Force Field
        • 255 No value received

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getInfraredByte in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        One of the values above.
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • getOiMode

        public int getOiMode()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the iRobot's OI mode. The returned value is encoded as follows:
        • 0 - Off
        • 1 - Passive
        • 2 - Safe
        • 3 - Full

            NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getOiMode in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        The iRobot's OI mode.

      • getSongNumber

        public int getSongNumber()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the currently selected OI song song number.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getSongNumber in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        the song number
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.readSensors(int sensorId)

      • leds

        public void leds(int powerColor,
                 int powerIntensity,
                 boolean spotLedOn)
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This method controls the LEDs on the iRobot. The state of the Play and Advance LEDs is specified by true or false. The Power LED is specified by two values: one for the color and the other for the intensity. Available in modes: Safe or Full

        Advance and Play LEDs use green LEDs. false = off, true = on
        Power uses a bicolor (red/green) LED. The intensity and color of this LED can be controlled with 8-bit resolution.

        Specified by:
        leds in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        powerColor - Power LED Color (0 - 255) 0 = green, 255 = red. Intermediate values are intermediate colors (orange, yellow, etc).
        powerIntensity - Power LED Intensity (0 - 255) 0 = off, 255 = full intensity. Intermediate values are intermediate intensities.
        spotLedOn - when true turn Play LED on.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • playSong

        public void playSong(int songNumber)
              throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Selects a song to play from the songs previously added to the iRobot using one of the song() methods. This method does nothing if a song is already playing. Note that the isSongPlaying() method can be used to check whether the iRobot is ready to accept this command. Available in modes: Safe or Full.
        Specified by:
        playSong in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        songNumber - the number of the song the iRobot is to play.
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.song(int, int[]), IRobotInterface.song(int, int[], int, int)

      • readSensors

        public void readSensors(int sensorId)
                 throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Retrieves one or more sensor values from the iRobot and stores the values locally. The values can later be accessed using any of the access methods. The sensors that are to be read are specified using a sensor id. There are 43 different sensor Ids; see the SENSORS_* constants. Each identifies a specific sensor or group of sensors.
        Specified by:
        readSensors in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        sensorId - One of the SENSORS_* constants
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • safe

        public void safe()
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Puts the OI into Safe mode, enabling user control of the iRobot. It turns off all LEDs. The OI can be in Passive, Safe, or Full mode to accept this command.
        Specified by:
        safe in interface IRobotInterface
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException

      • song

        public void song(int songNumber,
                 int[] notesAndDurations)
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This method lets you specify a song that you can play at a later time. Up to 16 songs can be specified. Each song is associated with a song number. Each song can contain up to sixteen notes. Each note is associated with a note number (in the range of (31 - 127) that uses MIDI note definitions and a duration that is specified in fractions of a second. The iRobot considers all musical notes outside the range of (31 - 127) as rest notes, and will make no sound during the duration of those notes. Available in modes: Passive, Safe, or Full
        Specified by:
        song in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        songNumber - The song number associated with the specific song. Must be in the range 0 through 15. If you send a second Song command, using the same song number, the old song is overwritten.
        notesAndDurations - An int array of even length. Every even index represents a note, every odd index is the duration of the preceding note in units of 1/64 second. Example: a half-second long musical note has a duration value of 32. Each entry in the array must be a number between 0 and 255 and the total length of the array must be 32 or less (max 16 notes).
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.playSong(int), IRobotInterface.song(int, int[]), IRobotInterface.song(int, int[], int, int), iRobot Create 2 Open Interface (OI)

      • song

        public void song(int songNumber,
                 int[] notesAndDurations,
                 int startIndex,
                 int length)
          throws ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        This method lets you specify a song that you can play at a later time. Up to 16 songs can be specified. Each song is associated with a song number. Each song can contain up to sixteen notes. Each note is associated with a note number (in the range of (31 - 127) that uses MIDI note definitions and a duration that is specified in fractions of a second. The iRobot considers all musical notes outside the range of (31 - 127) as rest notes, and will make no sound during the duration of those notes. Available in modes: Passive, Safe, or Full
        Specified by:
        song in interface IRobotInterface
        Parameters:
        songNumber - The song number associated with the specific song. Must be in the range 0 through 15. On a second invocation of the song() method, using the same song number, the old song is overwritten.
        notesAndDurations - An int array of even length. Every even index represents a note, every odd index is the duration of the preceding note in units of 1/64 second. Example: a half-second long musical note has a duration value of 32. Each entry in the array must be a number between 0 and 255.
        startIndex - an index into an int array specifying the first note
        length - an even number less than or equal to 32 (max 16 notes).
        Throws:
        ioio.lib.api.exception.ConnectionLostException
        See Also:
        IRobotInterface.playSong(int), IRobotInterface.song(int, int[]), iRobot Create 2 Open Interface (OI)

      • getEncoderCountLeft

        public int getEncoderCountLeft()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the left encoder count. This number will roll over to 0 after it passes 65535.There are 508.8 counts per revolution. The wheel diameter is 72mm and the distance between the wheels is 235mm.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getEncoderCountLeft in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        the left encoder count

      • getEncoderCountRight

        public int getEncoderCountRight()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Gets the right encoder count. This number will roll over to 0 after it passes 65535. There are 508.8 counts per revolution. The wheel diameter is 72mm and the distance between the wheels is 235mm.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getEncoderCountRight in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        the right encoder count

      • isStasis

        public boolean isStasis()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Returns true when the robot is making forward progress and false when it is not. This always returns false when the robot is turning, driving backward, or not driving.
        Specified by:

        the stasis value

      • getLightBumps

        public int[] getLightBumps()
        Description copied from interface: IRobotInterface
        Returns an array of length 6 where the values are from 0 to 5:

        • Light Bump Left
        • Light Bump Front Left
        • Light Bump Center Left
        • Light Bump Center Right
        • Light Bump Front Right
        • Light Bump Right

        The returned values are the signal strengths, where the maximum strength is 4095.

        NOTE: This method returns a locally stored value previously read from the iRobot. It is the client's responsibility to read the sensor values from the iRobot prior to calling this method in order to ensure fresh values.

        Specified by:
        getLightBumps in interface IRobotInterface
        Returns:
        the light bumps array
